config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.info.t:
Gives you info on a the {{commandName2}} command's settings.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[view]]`
Whitelist or blacklist certain roles or users from using the {{commandName2}} command. Also toggles between whitelist or blacklist modes.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[[whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove|enable|disable|view]]] <user|role>`
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.setCoo:
Sets a cooldown for using the {{commandName2}} command.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[cooldown [set|view]]] <time in seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.title: {{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}}
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.toggle:
Turns the {{commandName2}} command on or off.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[[on|off]]]`
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.currentCoo: The {{commandName}} command's cooldown is set to **{{cooldown}} seconds**.
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error:
I don't understand, try following this template:

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[cooldown [set|view]]] <amount of seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error.alre: The **{{commandName}}** command's cooldown is already **{{newCooldown}}** seconds.
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error.noCo: You need a number to set the cooldown to.
config.settings.cmds.error.noCommand: **{{commandName}}** is not a command name. Use `{{prefix}}[[commands]]` for a list of commands.
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.footer: You can get a list of commands using {{prefix}}[[commands]].
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.info.text:
Gives you info on a specific command's settings.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[view]]`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.lists.tex:
Whitelist or blacklist certain roles or users from using a command. Also toggles between whitelist or blacklist modes.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[[whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove|enable|disable|view]]] <user|role>`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.setCooldo:
Sets a cooldown for using a specific command.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[cooldown [set|view]]] <time in seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.title: {{prefix}}[[settings commands]]{{commandName}}
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.toggleCom:
Turns a specific command on or off.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[[on|off]]]`
config.settings.cmds.list.error:
I don't understand, try following this template:

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} {{listName}} [[[add|remove|enable|list]]] <username|role>`
config.settings.cmds.list.error.noListIt: **{{listItem}}** is not a role, user, or channel.
config.settings.cmds.list.listEmbed.blac: There are no blacklisted roles, users, or channels.
config.settings.cmds.list.listEmbed.whit: There are no whitelisted roles, users, or channels.
config.settings.cmds.whitelist.error.alr: **{{listItem}}** is already added to the whitelist.
**{{listItem}}** is already removed to the whitelist.
The {{commandName}} command is already set to follow the whitelist.
The {{commandName}} command's  whitelist is already disabled.
config.settings.dgs.embed.edit.text:
Edit game settings that are automatically applied to a game.

[[`{{prefix}}settings dgs]] <game setting> [[[on|off|<number>|view]
`]]
config.settings.dgs.embed.title: [[{{prefix}}settings dgs]]
config.settings.dgs.embed.view.text:
View the default game settings.

[[`{{prefix}}settings dgs view`]]
config.settings.dgs.error.alreadyOff: The {{gameSetting}} default game setting is already off.
config.settings.dgs.error.alreadyOn: The {{gameSetting}} default game setting is already on.
config.settings.dgs.error.alreadySet: The {{gameSetting}} default game setting is already set to {{newValue}}.
config.settings.dgs.error.voteNeeded: Vote for {{clientUsername}} at {{voteURL}} to change the default game settings.
config.settings.dgs.gameSettingEmbed:
Change the game setting by using:[[
`{{prefix}}settings dgs {{gameSetting}} {{usage}}`]].
config.settings.embed.title: {{clientUsername}} Settings
config.settings.error: I don't understand your command, use `{{prefix}}[[settings help]]`.
config.settings.info.desc: Adjusts how {{clientUsername}} works for the entire server.
config.settings.lang.contribute.embed.de: Help add or update languages for {{clientUsername}} to send its messages in.
config.settings.lang.contribute.embed.ho: You can help by translating text in the language file {{clientUsername}} uses to send its messages.
config.settings.lang.contribute.embed.wh: More info on how to access, translate, and submit the language file will be available soon.
config.settings.lang.embed.contribute.te:
Help add or update languages for servers to use.

[[`{{prefix}}settings language contribute`]]
config.settings.lang.embed.edit.text:
Edit the language in which {{clientUsername}} sends messages in. Use the language code which you can find with [[`{{prefix}}settings language list`]]

[[`{{prefix}}settings language <language code>`]]
config.settings.lang.embed.list.text:
Get a list of supported languages.

[[`{{prefix}}settings language list`]]
config.settings.lang.embed.title: {{prefix}}settings language
config.settings.lang.error.notValid: {{language}} is not a valid language, use `{{prefix}}settings language list` to get a list of supported languages.
config.settings.lang.list.embed.footer: Use "{{prefix}}settings lang contribute" to learn about adding/updating languages!
config.settings.lang.list.embed.title: Available Languages
config.settings.prefix.embed.title: {{prefix}}[[settings prefix]]
config.settings.prefix.error.samePrefix: The new prefix is already your current prefix.
config.settings.prefix.error.tooLong: Your new prefix cannot be longer than 10 characters.
config.settings.prefix.success: Ok, the prefix was changed to `{{newPrefix}}`

game.startgame.channelGreeting:
Welcome to the [[Uno-Channel]]! Use it to play your cards during the game!

**Basic Commands**
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[play]] <color of card> <number of card | type of card>` to play your cards.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[draw]]` if you don't have any matching cards.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[cards]]` if you don't know the name of your card.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[say]]` to talk to your opponents.

**Activated Game Settings**
{{customGameSettings}}
game.startgame.channelGreeting.single:
Welcome to your Uno-Channel! Use it to play your cards during the game!

**Basic Commands**
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[play]] <color of card> <number of card | type of card>` to play your cards.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[draw]]` if you don't have any matching cards.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[cards]]` if you don't know the name of your card.
 • Use `{{prefix}}[[say]]` to talk to your opponents.

**Enabled Game Settings**
{{customGameSettings}}
game.startgame.error.4playerCap: Vote for {{clientUsername}} at {{voteURL}} to play with more than 4 players!
game.startgame.error.noManageRoles: The [["SpectateGame"]] game setting requires the [[`manageRoles`]] permission to run.
game.startgame.error.noPlayersFound: Mention the players you want in the command. Use `{{prefix}}startgame help` for more info.
game.startgame.error.notEnoughPlayers: You need at least 2 players. Bots, other than {{clientUsername}}, do not count
game.startgame.error.playerCap: There are too many people! You can only have 8 players at most.
game.startgame.error.runningGame: There is already a game running. Use `{{prefix}}[[endgame]]` to stop it.
game.startgame.gameStarted.multiChannel: A game of Uno has started. Go to your uno channel titled with your username.
game.startgame.gameStarted.singleChannel: A game of Uno has started in this channel.
game.startgame.info.usage.notes: يجب أن يكون لديك لاعبان على الأقل لبدء اللعبة ، ولا تحسب الروبوتات.
game.startgame.info.usage.tips: Use `{{prefix}}[[gamesettings list]]` to get a list of the game settings.
You can change the default game settings using `{{prefix}}[[settings dgs]]`.
game.startgame.main.embed.footer: اضغط  [['🖐️']] للانضمام للعبة, [['▶️']] للبدأ, و [['❌']] لألغاء اللعبة.
game.startgame.main.embed.title: لعبة أونو ستبدأ!
game.startgame.spectateGreeting:
مرحبًا بك في قناة Uno-Spectators! استخدمه لمشاهدة المباراة!

**أوامر أساسية**
 • اكتب `{{prefix}}[[spectate]] [[[on|off]]]` للانضمام إلى هذه القناة أو مغادرتها.
 • اكتب `{{prefix}}[[say]]` للتكلم مع اللاعبين.

**اعدادات اللعبة.**
{{customGameSettings}}
game.startgame.warning.alreadyDefault: {{newValue}} is already the default for the {{gameSetting}} game setting.
game.startgame.warning.firstEight: Only the first 8 will play. You can only have 8 players at most.
game.startgame.warning.firstFour: Only the first 4 will play. Vote for {{clientUsername}} at {{voteURL}} to play with more than 4 players!
game.startgame.warning.gameSettingMax: {{newValue}} is over the max of {{maxValue}} for the {{gameSetting}} game setting.
game.startgame.warning.gameSettingMin: {{newValue}} is under the min of {{minValue}} for the {{gameSetting}} game setting.
game.startgame.warning.gsNoNumber: "{{newValue}}" needs to be a number for the {{gameSetting}} game setting.
game.startgame.warning.gsRequiresBool: The "{{gameSetting}}" game setting requires a number value.
game.startgame.warning.gsRequiresNum: The "{{gameSetting}}" game setting requires a number value.

game.uno.error.notInGame: You need to be in a game to callout.
game.uno.error.noUnoCallout: The *UnoCallout* game setting must be on for you to call out a player.
game.uno.info.usage.notes: The [[**UnoCallout**]] game setting must be enabled for this command to work.
This command only works in uno-channels.
game.uno.info.usage.tips: You can type just "Uno!" (only in your uno-channel) to use this command.

info.commands.embed.footer: Use "{{prefix}}cmds <command name>" to get more info on a command.
info.commands.embed.title: {{clientUsername}} Commands
info.guide.commands.desc:
**Turn commands on/off:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [on|off]`]] to toggle the command.
 • Replace "<command>" with the name of the command, excluding the prefix.
 • Replace "[on|off]", with *on* or *off*.

**Change command cooldowns:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> cooldown set <time>`]] to set a cooldown for the command.
 • Replace "<time>" with how long (in seconds) you would like the cooldown to last.
 • You can view the command's current cooldown by using `{{prefix}}settings commands <command> cooldown view`.

**Whitelist or blacklist commands:**

 • Use `{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [whitelist|blacklist] [on|off]` to turn the whitelist/blacklist on or off.
 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove] <user|role>`]] to add or remove a user or role to the whitelist/blacklist.
 • A whitelist only allows the people on the list to use the command.
 • A blacklist stops only the people on the list from using the command.
 • Disabling both will allow anyone to use the command.

**View command settings:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> view`]] to see command info like the state, whitelist, and blacklist.
info.guide.commands.title: Changing the Server's Command Settings Guide
info.guide.embed.desc:
:arrow_forward: **Starting a game:**

[[`{{prefix}}guide start`]]
How to start a game of Uno.

:round_pushpin: **Playing your cards:**

[[`{{prefix}}guide play`]]
How to play your cards in a game of Uno.

:speech_balloon: **Changing command settings:**

[[`{{prefix}}guide commands`]]
Change the server's individual command settings.

:gear: **Changing server settings:**

[[`{{prefix}}guide settings`]]
Change the server settings like the prefix and default game settings.

:wrench: **Changing user options:**

[[`{{prefix}}guide options`]]
Change your personal options to tailor your experience.
info.guide.embed.title: {{clientUsername}} Guide
info.guide.info.desc: Tells you an in-depth guide on how to use {{clientUsername}}.
info.guide.options.desc:
• User options only affect the user's experience, not the entire server's.

**Enabling and disabling options:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}options <option name> [on|off]`]] to turn an option on or off.
 • Replace "<option name>" with the name of the option, a list can be found using [[`{{prefix}}options list`]].
 • Replace "[on|off]", with *on* or *off*, depending on which you would like.

**View options:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}options view`]] to view your enabled options.
info.guide.options.title: Changing Your User Options
info.guide.play.desc:
**Reading Embeds:**

 • Open the uno-channel with your username after you have started a game (using [[`{{prefix}}startgame`]]).
 • The pinned message will show some basic commands to play, the options you have enabled, and the game settings that are enabled.
 • A message will be sent, telling you the current player and the current card.

**Playing a Card:**

 • Use the [[`{{prefix}}play`]] command to play your card. (Use [[`{{prefix}}play help`]] for more command info.)
 • The play command  requires a color and a number/type of card.
 • Use [[`{{prefix}}cards`]] for the names of your cards.
 • Your command should look something like this: `{{prefix}}play red 5`.
 • If you are playing a wild card, make sure to add the color you want. [[`{{prefix}}play blue wild`]]

**Drawing a Card:**

 • If you don't have a card to play, use [[`{{prefix}}draw`]] to draw a card from the deck.
 • After drawing your turn will be over, unless the game setting [[DrawUntilMatch]] is on.
info.guide.play.title: Playing Cards Guide
info.guide.settings.desc:
**Changing the prefix:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings prefix <new prefix>`]] to change the prefix.
 • Replace "<new prefix>" with your new prefix.

**Add or remove default game settings:**

 • Default game settings (DGS) are game settings that will be applied to every game with no game settings automatically.
 • Changing DGS require you to vote, which may take a few minutes to update.
 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings dgs <game setting> [on|off|view]` ]]to turn DGS on or off.
 • Replace "<game setting>" with a game setting from [[`{{prefix}}gamesettings list`]].
 • Replace "[on|off]" with *on* or *off*, depending on if you want to turn the DGS on or off.

**Reset {{clientUsername}}:**

 • Use [[`{{prefix}}settings reset`]] to reset {{clientUsername}}.
 • This will reset all of the data {{clientUsername}} has on your server.
 • When prompted, respond only with "CONFIRM" in all caps to confirm the reset.
info.guide.settings.title: Changing the Server's Settings Guide
info.guide.start.desc:
**Creating a game:**

 • Start a game using [[`{{prefix}}startgame`]]. (Use [[`{{prefix}}startgame help`]] for more command info.)
 • Add game settings by typing a list of game settings separated by spaces. (A list of game settings can be found with `{{prefix}}gamesettings list`.)
 • Your command might look like this: [[`{{prefix}}startgame StackCards, DisableJoin`]].
 • A startgame message will be sent which allows you to join, start, and end the game using the reactions, :hand_splayed:, :arrow_forward:, and :x: respectively.
 • After 30 seconds or a force start, your game will start.

**Navigating to your channel:**

 • A category named 'uno-category' will be created after your game begins.
 • A text channel will be created in this category for each player you mentioned.
 • The channel is where the player will play their cards.
info.guide.start.title: Starting A Game Guide
